basics.name: Piyush Mishra
basics.label: Data Science Practitioner, Self-Taught Researcher, Writer
basics.summary: I am an internet-educated machine learning practitioner primarily focusing on natural language processing and linguistic history. However, I also dabble in computer vision, reinforcement learning and related domains. I have had the opportunity to work alongside some reputed researchers from institutions like University of Calcutta, Indian Institute of Technology Patna, Larsen & Toubro Limited etc. Presently, I am pursuing a degree in B.Tech in Computer Science from International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar. Besides my professional interests, I also have a senior diploma in classical Tabla percussion (Delhi school) and Hindustani classical music (Gwalior school) from the reputed Prayag Sangeet Samiti, Allahabad.

education.institution: International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar

education.area: Mathematics, Science, Social Science, English, French

work.company: Center for Security and Emerging Technology, Georgetown University
highlights: I participated in answering research questions for AI ethics and policymaking
I worked closely with the Research team for devising novel strategies of information retrieval and text extraction with specific focus towards text classification.

I was involved in developing computations for gene clustering, seeking to achieve better computation than in the existing strategies in the domain. I largely devised a multi-modal strategy to work on incomplete data of different views of gene data.

I worked heavily to develop artificially intelligent means for sustainable agriculture which helped in bridging the gap between farmers and technology. It included research and development in areas of agriculture and cropping patterns combined with novel techniques of computation in deep learning.

I worked on a comparative study on human activity recognition using deep neural network approaches and sought to simplify the previously used techniques to remove unnecessary complexities. The corresponding research paper was selected to be presented at the 5th International Conference on Data Science and Engineering, 2019.

I assisted in two power distribution projects for L&T Electrical and Automation; IPDS (client MPPKVVCL) and R-APDRP (client CESU). For the R-APDRP project, I wrote scripts and ran some basic queries for handling data in SQL and for the IPDS project I made a basic prototype for finding out the suspicious customers of the smart meters in the city of Indore.

work.position: Algorithm and Data Structure Developer Intern
highlights: I worked on developing algorithms in the field of machine learning and deep learning. It involved writing about the algorithms as well as contributing codes for the algorithms.
I represented IIM Bangalore at IIIT-Bh for the anual business festival, Vistas'18

Born from the simple idea that artificial intelligence can be a force for good, the Rhodes Artificial Intelligence Lab (RAIL) applies machine learning to some of the world's most difficult social challenges. It creates state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence to diagnose diseases, reduce emissions, improve homeless shelters, and even translate ancient languages.

It is a coveted society dedicated towards research, development and advancement in the field of data science and analytics. Being a part of this society has helped me gain more knowledge and further develop my interest in the domain.

Kaggle Days Delhi is a branch of the Kaggle Days initiative functioning in the city of Delhi and the National Capital Territory of India. It helps inculcate a culture of learning with and for AI by bringing data scientists, students and researchers together to interact and create disruptive ideas and implementations.

volunteer.position: Mentor for Machine Learning, Summer of Algorithms
highlights: Thanks to this initiative, I had the chance to introduce concepts of machine learning and AI to complete beginners and enthusiasts to make them confident and competent in the workforce.
I had the chance to mentor open source contributors for my project Fake News Detector
It is a co-operative campus society based on peer-teaching which helped me gain knowledge on open source and git
I was primarily involved with organising regularly scheduled, free of cost debate sessions
